headline: US gives Poland the 'green light' to give Ukraine MIG fighter jets as Russia warns it is at WAR with ANY country hosting Kyiv's aircraft and points finger at Romania as top American general inspects troops in Europe
author: Keith Griffith *
sentences:
The deal would see Ukraine take Poland's 28 Russian-made MiG-29 warplanes, which would in turn be replaced by a fresh set of F-16's
Comments:
*, James Gordon, and Bhvishya Patel
The trick is to know these things in advance, and to arrange one's investments accordingly.

US Secretary of State Antony Blinken said today that the country was in talks with Poland in order to orchestrate a deal that would allow Polish fighter jets to be flown by pilots from the Ukrainian Air Force in order to combat Russia's air superiority.

And if this drags us into a hot war, all the better because there's money to be made by the arms dealers, and even more by the corporations that will rebuild power plants, dams, and other huge infrastructure elements.

Plans for Poland to send fighter jets to Ukraine have been given the 'green light' by the US amid warnings from Russia that countries hosting Kyiv's military aircraft could end up being involved in an armed conflict.
